result.execSummary:
The defendant Devan S. Domenosky was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Devan S. Domenosky is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Devan S. Domenosky was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Submit voluntarily to random tests of blood, breath or urine.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
**  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
Submit a DNA sample (unless previously provided)
** Pay DNA surcharge (unless previously paid).  Cooperate with the Child Support Agency to establish paternity and/or to pay child support and make all court appearances in any paternity action.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Devan S. Domenosky

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State.  Def. appeared with Atty Everett King.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 1 - Sentenced to 9 months Co. Jail; sentence stayed, placed on probation for 18 months w/conditions.

Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant, Devan S. Domenosky, appeared with Attorney Everett King.  Clerk: PT
Case is resolved; plea questionnaire filed.  Deft. pleads Guilty; found guilty by the court.  PSI Ordered for Sentencing on 10/15/14 at 10:00 AM.
*Count 1 - Plea of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Count 2 - Dismissed on State motion.  kz

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State. Def. appeared in court with Atty. Everett King. Clerk LE.  Plea offer placed on the record by the State.  Prelim. waived, probable cause found. Request for substitution of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. King. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman. Bound over to Br. 8. Information filed, plea of not guilty. Judicial pretrial on 9-3-14 @ 9:20am. Bond continued.
of Judge Schroeder filed by Atty. King. Tab pulled for Judge Kerkman

122 p.m.  Attorney Michael Graveley appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney E King.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Comm Mason on 8/21/14 @ 9 a.m.  Atty King moves to dismiss 2nd and subsequent enhancer on Ct 1.  Court denies motion.  Bond - continued.
Preliminary hearing on August 21, 2014 at 09:00 am.

159pm  Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person.  Clerk: LE  Def. is referred to the Public Defender.  If not eligible, def. to retain his own counsel. Court date will not be adjourned due to def.'s failure to retain counsel.  Initial appearance adjourned to 8/5/14 @ 1:00pm w/Comm Mason, 927-54th Street, Rm 157, Kenosha, WI.  $1500  Signature Bond Set w/conditions (see bond event).  kmk

*Not to possess or consume Alcohol.  *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription. *No drug paraphernalia
